citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care is missing. Animal health may be at risk without readily available veterinary
guidance. Licensee shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements, which includes a written program
of veterinary care.
Correct by: July 21, 2025

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two blue and gold macaws are excessively itchy. The birds are constantly scratching and picking at themselves. Many of
their feathers are missing, exposing bare skin. The skin appears thick and lumpy with spots of blood diffusely present.
The birds have not been treated, nor evaluated by a veterinarian, and are in distress. Each licensee shall establish and
maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose,
and treat diseases and injuries. A licensed veterinarian must be consulted for examination, diagnosis, and treatment.
Veterinary treatment guidance must be followed exactly.
Correct by: July 16, 2025

The facility does not have an accurate, up to date inventory of animals on hand. One inventory was found dated eight
years ago. It is difficult to trace animals in the event of a disease outbreak without accurate records. Licensee shall make,
keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the required information, including animals on hand, those
born or hatched, transported, sold, euthanized, or other dispositions.
Correct by: July 21, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The written program of veterinary care is missing. Animal health may be at risk without readily available veterinary 
guidance. Licensee shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements, which includes a written program 
of veterinary care. 
 
Correct by: July 21, 2025 
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two blue and gold macaws are excessively itchy. The birds are constantly scratching and picking at themselves. Many of 
their feathers are missing, exposing bare skin. The skin appears thick and lumpy with spots of blood diffusely present. 
The birds have not been treated, nor evaluated by a veterinarian, and are in distress. Each licensee shall establish and 
maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, 
and treat diseases and injuries. A licensed veterinarian must be consulted for examination, diagnosis, and treatment. 
Veterinary treatment guidance must be followed exactly. 
 
Correct by: July 16, 2025 
2.75(b) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility does not have an accurate, up to date inventory of animals on hand. One inventory was found dated eight 
years ago. It is difficult to trace animals in the event of a disease outbreak without accurate records. Licensee shall make, 
keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the required information, including animals on hand, those 
born or hatched, transported, sold, euthanized, or other dispositions. 
 
Correct by: July 21, 2025

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
